csrf.eli5: It’s like someone tricking your little brother into doing something bad using your toys.
csrf.boss: CSRF is a type of attack where a malicious site tricks users into executing unwanted actions on another site where they’re authenticated.
csrf.sysadmin: Cross-Site Request Forgery occurs when unauthorized commands are transmitted from a user that the web application trusts, typically via cookies or stored credentials.
csrf.use_case: CSRF tokens are added to forms to prevent fake submissions from other websites.

subresource_integrity_sri.eli5: It’s like checking if your package hasn’t been opened before using it.
subresource_integrity_sri.boss: SRI is a security feature that ensures externally loaded files like scripts or styles haven't been tampered with.
subresource_integrity_sri.sysadmin: Subresource Integrity uses cryptographic hash checks (e.g. SHA-384) in HTML tags to validate the integrity of external resources.
subresource_integrity_sri.use_case: Used to safely load third-party scripts like jQuery from a CDN.

hsts_http_strict_transport_security.eli5: It tells your browser to always use a secure path and never take shortcuts.
hsts_http_strict_transport_security.boss: HSTS is a browser policy that forces all connections to a site to use HTTPS, enhancing security.
hsts_http_strict_transport_security.sysadmin: HTTP Strict Transport Security is a security header instructing browsers to only use HTTPS, helping prevent downgrade and cookie hijacking attacks.
hsts_http_strict_transport_security.use_case: Used by banking websites to ensure all traffic is encrypted and secure.

referrer_policy.eli5: It tells your browser how much personal info to share when you click a link.
referrer_policy.boss: Referrer Policy controls how much referrer information is passed between websites to protect user privacy.
referrer_policy.sysadmin: A security header that limits or modifies the Referer HTTP header sent when navigating between sites or loading resources.
referrer_policy.use_case: Used to prevent leaking sensitive URLs to third-party analytics or embeds.

permissions_policy.eli5: It’s like setting rules about who can touch the remote control at home.
permissions_policy.boss: Permissions Policy lets websites control which browser features (like camera or fullscreen) are allowed.
permissions_policy.sysadmin: A security header that allows or blocks use of powerful browser features on a per-origin basis, formerly Feature Policy.
permissions_policy.use_case: Used to block iframes from accessing the camera or microphone.

secure_headers.eli5: They’re like safety instructions for your browser to follow when visiting a website.
secure_headers.boss: Secure headers are HTTP response headers that help enforce browser security policies to reduce vulnerabilities.
secure_headers.sysadmin: Security-related HTTP response headers like HSTS, CSP, X-Frame-Options, and Referrer-Policy that guide browser behavior and mitigate attacks.
secure_headers.use_case: Used to reduce risk of XSS, clickjacking, and information leakage in web apps.

version_control.eli5: It’s like a save button that remembers every version of your work so you can go back anytime.
version_control.boss: Version control tracks changes to files over time and helps teams collaborate safely and efficiently.
version_control.sysadmin: A system that manages file changes over time, enabling branching, merging, and history tracking—commonly via Git.
version_control.use_case: Used by developers to manage code changes and roll back when needed.

git.eli5: Git is like a time machine for your code—it remembers everything you did.
git.boss: Git is a distributed version control system that helps teams track and merge code changes efficiently.
git.sysadmin: Git is a CLI-based distributed VCS supporting commits, branches, and merging with strong support for collaboration and history rewrites.
git.use_case: Used to manage feature branches during software development.

github.eli5: GitHub is like a giant online folder where people store and share their coding projects.
github.boss: GitHub is a cloud-based platform for hosting and collaborating on Git repositories with built-in CI/CD and issue tracking.
github.sysadmin: GitHub provides Git repository hosting with web-based collaboration tools, pull requests, issue tracking, and GitHub Actions for automation.
github.use_case: Used to collaborate on open source projects and track contributions.
